comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The militant suffragist, "General" Rosalie Jones, who had led a women's rights march from New York to Washington in January, 1913 (designed to seize publicity during festivities surrounding the inauguration of President Woodrow Wilson) followed that feat in December-January [1913-1914] with a march of suffragists from New York City to Albany.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of the indefatigable "General" Rosalie Jones, leading the suffragist march from NYC to Albany, New York [January 1, 1914]:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4690770664/in/photostream/]
